intro: Amyema medinillicola, commonly known as the Mediterranean amyema, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in southern Europe and parts of the United States.
